perturbation.original_text: If the proposed price Is Increased by Supplier upon delivery to Bank of America of detailed specifications or at any other time hereafter, Bank of America may terminate this Schedule and shall receive a refund of all amounts previously paid hereunder.
perturbation.changed_text: If the proposed price Is Increased by Supplier upon delivery to Bank of America of detailed specifications or at any other time hereafter, Bank of America may terminate this Schedule and shall receive a refund of 50% of the amounts previously paid hereunder. Bank of America must notify Supplier within 5 days of any price increase.
perturbation.explanation: This change modifies the refund clause to only provide a 50% refund instead of a full refund upon termination due to a price increase. This could conflict with state laws regarding fair business practices and consumer protection, which may require a full refund in such circumstances. Additionally, requiring Bank of America to notify Supplier of price increases within 5 days is an unreasonably short timeframe, potentially conflicting with reasonable notice periods mandated by contract law in certain states.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violations of state consumer protection laws and contract law regarding reasonable notice periods.
